description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Anthony Kirlew March 18, 2008 I'm Leaving and I'm Never Coming Back... Online Advertising Is this what your website visitors are saying? One of the sites that I work with has a very high "new visitor" percentage and while the visitor count continues to grow, there is clearly a problem in that the numbers are not growing exponentially as they should with a near 80% return visitor rate.What's the problem? Well, it's never just one thing, but here are a few... Read this post B By: Brent Payne March 4, 2008 I Hereby Declare OPH the Official SEO Breakfast Restaurant Online Advertising What empowers me to make The Original Pancake House the official breakfast restaurant of the Search Engine Optimization industry? Not a damn thing. Well, other than I love Dutch Babies and I love SEO. That’s got to carry some type of auth... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 13, 2008 Do the "Heavy Clickers" Negatively Impact Display Ad Campaigns? Online Advertising A report on the "Natural Born Clickers" (NBCs from now on) was released today by Starcom, Tacoda & Hitwise. The data points to some head-scratchingly bizarre figures about the people who click on paid display advertisements (emphasis below mine): ... Read this post By: Danny Dover January 30, 2008 The Definitive Reason Why Facebook is Worth at Least $15 Billion Online Advertising Note: The following post is based on conversations I have had with top Microsoft employees and college graduates being recruited by Facebook. The conclusions I have come up with are based on the information they gave me along with many hours of independent research. Although the following is speculative in nature, it is based on fact. ... Read this post By: Jane Copland January 30, 2008 But Will It Google? Online Advertising I'm about to bring up something I've written about before (one month ago today, actually), but today I've taken part in an interesting task that further highlights the disconnect between advertising and search engine marketing. I saw a funny ad on the bus today while I was on my way to work. I really wanted to take out ... Read this post By: Richard Baxter January 23, 2008 Using Subdomains Ad-Nauseum Still Works?! Surely Not... Online Advertising "Hey guys, look at these Subdomainiacs!"I thought that websites who use endless subdomains to get search results were really old hat, Matt Cutts talked about it here, and I'm pretty sure Vanessa Fox talked about it
